jobs.title: Chief of Staff
jobs.descriptionHtml:
ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES

Beam is on a mission to shift $10B from brands to high-impact nonprofits by creating what loyalty would look like if it were designed for today’s customers.

This is a unique opportunity to have a massive individual impact: our products have rapidly scaled to millions of users, driving tremendous resources to nonprofits and inspiring more people to start making a bigger impact every day.

The Chief of Staff will act as a force multiplier for the CEO and executive team, helping to drive clarity, alignment, and execution across the company - enabling Beam to scale rapidly without losing focus or mission alignment.

This is a highly strategic and execution-heavy role. You’ll be at the center of decision-making and operations, including, but not limited to:

  • Working closely with the CEO and leadership team to define company OKRs, identify highest-leverage priorities, and ensure the company stays on track to meet them.

  • Serving as a central point of coordination across Product, Sales, Marketing, and Operations to keep teams aligned, accountable, and communicating effectively.

  • Supporting the CEO in decision-making, communication, and follow-through on key initiatives. Prepping for board meetings, investor updates, and executive communications.

  • Owning special projects that don’t sit neatly within one department but are critical to Beam’s growth.

  • Helping build and reinforce strong communication norms, operating cadences, and a mission-driven culture across the team.

ABOUT YOU

This is a role for someone who thrives in a high-growth, mission-driven startup and wants to work at the heart of a company that’s doing meaningful work in the world. You’re an exceptional problem solver and operator, highly organized and comfortable wearing many hats.

You may have startup, consulting, operations, product, or strategy experience - but what sets you apart is your ability to drive clarity, communicate with influence, and execute relentlessly.

We’re looking for:

  • 5+ years of relevant experience: ideally including a mix of startup, consulting, strategy, or operations work (Bonus: You've worked closely with executive teams or in high-growth, mission-driven environments.)

  • Excellent strategic thinking and problem-solving skills

  • Strong project and stakeholder management skills

  • Exceptional written and verbal communication

  • High emotional intelligence and adaptability

  • A bias toward execution and mission-driven mindset

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required

BENEFITS & PERKS

In addition to cash compensation, stock, healthcare, and remote work, Beam will also offer the following perks, as further set forth in the applicable policies:

  • Unlimited PTO: All Beam team members are entitled to unlimited paid time off, with a requirement to take a minimum of two weeks per year.

  • Health and wellness: Your choice of Medical, Dental, and Vision Aetna plans, including some that are fully covered plus a $100 monthly wellness stipend to be used at your discretion (e.g., gym memberships, yoga, meditation apps, etc.)

  • Parental leave: All parents are entitled to paid leave per Beam’s parental leave policy. Upon your start date, this includes twelve weeks of fully paid leave after six months of full-time employment at Beam.

  • Professional development enrichment: $750 / year in professional development stipend for conferences, books, course enrollment, and more

  • Regular team events and volunteering, including virtual options

  • Regular on-sites: Travel and hotel covered for on-sites 1-2x per year for the entire Beam team to come together for team-building in NYC

  • Referral bonus: $1,000 referral bonuses for every new member of the growing Beam team that you send our way

  • Remote first with optional NYC HQ: This role may be conducted fully remotely, with the option to work from our gorgeous New York City HQ with sunlight, plants, drinks, snacks, and energy

REPORTING

You will initially report to Beam’s CEO and then to Head of Sales.

COMPENSATION

Your total compensation consists of four parts: base salary, performance based bonus at on-target earnings, partial 401k match, and stock options.

Total cash compensation for this role is $170,000 - $180,000 OTE per year.

Beam is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

We are a remote-friendly company that is able to hire in all 50 states and D.C and Canada. We can’t sponsor working visas, so all applicants will need to have work authorization in the US or Canada.

jobs.title: Data Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Are you looking to join a highly motivated team working for social impact? At Beam we’re on a mission to shift $10 Billion to high-impact nonprofits.

About the role

As a Data Engineer on our Engineering team with a focus on data development, you will be working with a team of talented developers responsible for helping create and maintain the data infrastructure and processes that power the internal and external facing business intelligence to drive Beam’s mission. Our data platform processes more than 7TB of data every 90 minutes, delivering complex analytics to our partners and actionable data to our internal stakeholders. You will have the opportunity to work with a wide range of open source data technologies, building new features, supporting existing functionality through bug fixing and enhancements, and will have a significant impact on a core part of our business.

We’re a highly collaborative team motivated by impact and our high growth environment. This is an opportunity for someone excited to have a high level of impact on Beam’s continued success.

Our Data tech stack

  • Apache Spark running pyspark

  • Kubernetes running on EKS; managed using k9s, Helm and eksctl

  • Apache Airflow as our workflow orchestrator

  • Testing automation via pytest

  • uv as our Python package manager

  • Snowflake as our data warehouse

  • S3 as our distributed object storage / data lake

What you’ll do

  • Design and plan new platform data solutions through collaboration with our Staff Data Engineer, product team, and internal stakeholders using RFC and Tech Spec documents

  • Collaborate with your peers to execute and implement high-quality software

  • Collaborate with your peers to assist in planning and execution of new features, bringing a focus on data platform requirements

  • Drive the execution of your work from spec document to delivery, with assistance from our Staff Data Engineer and other peers

  • Grow your skillset and be a force multiplier by sharing knowledge through code reviews, pair programming, 1-1 conversations, and broader team trainings

  • Develop subject matter expertise in the Beam data ecosystem and our reporting platform through code development, directly supporting our Client Strategy team, Business Operations, and our partners

  • Understand and strive to balance tech debt with practicality while designing solutions

  • Gain knowledge of the nonprofit giving and e-commerce enablement spaces

  • Foster a team culture around Beam’s values of community, inclusivity, care, accountability and support

  • Strive for continuous improvement through goal setting, feedback, and other growth opportunities

What we’re looking for

  • 2+ years utilizing Python and SQL to develop data intensive applications or insights, or 3+ years of experience as a Software Engineer using Python and SQL, working in a primarily Python codebase

  • Experience working on production-level data systems in a collaborative team environment

  • Proficient with Python and SQL

  • Proficient with relational databases, particularly PostgreSQL

  • Familiar with fundamental development principles and processes such as observability, performance optimization, continuous integration, automated testing, and cloud infrastructure

  • Familiar with distributed computing architecture, data warehouse and data lake storage patterns

  • Strong communication skills with the ability to explain and advocate for technical projects to non-technical roles

Nice to haves

  • Experience in an early startup

  • Experience with a Business Intelligence tool, like Tableau

  • Experience with Apache Spark, Apache Airflow or Kubernetes

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related technical or analytical field (or equivalent training, fellowship, or work experience)

Compensation and perks

  • Expected annual compensation range: $154,000-181,500 USD

    • Base salary $140,000-165,000 USD

    • Up to 10% annual bonus based entirely on individual performance

  • Stock options

  • 50% match on 401k contributions of up to 6% of base salary

  • $100 monthly wellness stipend

  • $750 annual professional development budget

  • See a full list of perks at https://beamimpact.com/careers

Location - Remote

We are a remote-first company, so our team works from wherever they are. We also have office space in New York, currently in Hearst Tower, where you’re free to come work from as well. We have no plans to require in-office work.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the role

As a Senior Software Engineer on our team, you will be working with a team of talented developers responsible for creating the core software that powers Beam’s mission. You will have the opportunity to work with a wide range of frontend and backend technologies, building new features, supporting existing functionality through bug fixing and enhancements, and helping us to continue levelling up our development practices. You’ll work closely with our product team and your fellow engineers to design and deliver practical and scalable solutions from spec to production.

We’re a highly collaborative team motivated by impact and our high growth environment. This is an opportunity for someone excited to have a high level of impact on Beam’s continued success.

Our tech stack

  • NodeJS and Typescript for most of our backend

  • NextJS, React, and Typescript for our partner-facing portal site

  • Lit web components for our SDK frontend

  • PostgreSQL data store

  • AWS ECS, Lambdas, and other cloud services

What you’ll do

  • Plan and refine new solutions through collaboration with our product and engineering teams using RFC and Tech Spec documents

  • Drive the execution of your projects throughout the SDLC

  • Be a force multiplier by sharing knowledge through code reviews, pair programming, 1-1 conversations, and broader team trainings

  • Participate in on-call rotation for production infrastructure support

  • Develop subject matter expertise in key areas of the Beam technology stack

  • Gain knowledge of the nonprofit giving and e-commerce enablement spaces

  • Foster a team culture around Beam’s values of community, inclusivity, care, accountability and support

  • Strive for continuous improvement through goal setting, feedback, and other growth opportunities

What we’re looking for

  • 4+ years building production systems for complex web applications

  • Proficient in developing web applications using a Javascript-based framework such as React, NextJS, or similar

  • Proficient in web architecture principles and API design

  • Proficient with relational databases, particularly PostgreSQL

  • Familiar with fundamental development principles and processes such as observability, performance optimization, continuous integration, automated testing, and cloud infrastructure

  • Strong communication skills with the ability to explain and advocate for technical projects to non-technical roles

Nice to haves

  • Experience in an early startup

  • Experience building e-commerce sites, or building integrations with e-commerce platforms

  • Experience in a technical support or technical integration role

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related technical field (or equivalent training, fellowship, or work experience)

Compensation and perks

  • Expected annual compensation range: $181,500-203,500 USD

    • Base salary $165,000-185,000 USD

    • Up to 10% annual bonus based entirely on individual performance

  • Stock options

  • 50% match on 401k contributions of up to 6% of base salary

  • $100 monthly wellness stipend

  • $750 annual professional development budget

  • See a full list of perks at https://beamimpact.com/careers

Location - Remote

We are a remote-first company, so our team works from wherever they are. We also have office space in New York, currently in Hearst Tower, where you’re free to come work from as well. We have no plans to require in-office work.

This is a unique opportunity to have a massive individual impact: our products have rapidly scaled to millions of users, driving tremendous resources to nonprofits and inspiring more people to start making a bigger impact every day.

As Director of People, you’ll be the architect and champion of our people strategy. This is a highly impactful, cross-functional role focused on building the infrastructure, policies, and culture that enable our team to thrive as we scale.

You’ll work closely with the CEO and leadership team to ensure Beam is a place where values-aligned talent is attracted, empowered, and retained by:

  • Developing and executing Beam’s holistic people strategy, aligned with company goals, values, and growth stage

  • Act as a trusted advisor to the CEO and leadership team on organizational design, talent planning, and change management

  • Owning employee lifecycle from onboarding to offboarding, ensuring every team member feels connected, valued, and supported

  • Designing and run performance management, feedback, and career development systems that help individuals grow and the organization scale effectively

  • Coaching managers to become great leaders, and support learning & development initiatives across all levels

  • Overseeing compensation, benefits, and HR compliance; partner with Finance on headcount planning and budgeting

  • Selecting and managing people systems (e.g., HRIS, payroll, performance tools) to support efficiency and scalability

ABOUT YOU

You're a builder and a strategist - equally comfortable setting the vision for the people function and rolling up your sleeves to make it happen. You’re deeply invested in people and culture, excited by the opportunity to shape the experience of every team member, and energized by working in a fast-moving, purpose-driven environment.

We’re looking for someone who has:

  • 6+ years of experience in People/HR roles, with 3+ years in a leadership or strategic HRBP capacity at a fast-growing startup or mission-driven organization

  • A proven track record building or scaling people functions across recruiting, performance, engagement, and culture

  • Experience designing equitable compensation, leveling frameworks, and growth pathways

  • Strong knowledge of HR compliance, labor laws, and best practices for remote or hybrid teams

  • Exceptional communication skills - both written and verbal - and a high EQ

  • A passion for diversity, equity, inclusion, and building cultures where everyone can thrive

  • Strong project management skills and a bias toward action

  • A thoughtful, human-first approach - you believe the best teams are built on trust, clarity, and compassion

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required

In addition to cash compensation, stock, healthcare, and remote work, Beam will also offer the following perks, as further set forth in the applicable policies:

  • Health and wellness: Your choice of Medical, Dental, and Vision Aetna plans, including some that are fully covered plus a $100 monthly wellness stipend to be used at your discretion (e.g., gym memberships, yoga, meditation apps, etc.)

  • Parental leave: All parents are entitled to paid leave per Beam’s parental leave policy. Upon your start date, this includes twelve weeks of fully paid leave after six months of full-time employment at Beam.

  • Professional development enrichment: $750 / year in professional development stipend for conferences, books, course enrollment, and more

  • Regular team events and volunteering, including virtual options

  • Regular on-sites: Travel and hotel covered for on-sites 1-2x per year for the entire Beam team to come together for team-building in NYC

  • Referral bonus: $1,000 referral bonuses for every new member of the growing Beam team that you send our way

  • Remote first with optional NYC HQ: This role may be conducted fully remotely, with the option to work from our gorgeous New York City HQ with sunlight, plants, drinks, snacks, and energy

REPORTING

You will initially report to Beam’s CEO.

COMPENSATION

Your total compensation consists of four parts: base salary, performance based bonus at on-target earnings, partial 401k match, and stock options.

Total cash compensation for this role is $165,000 - $178,000 per year.

Beam is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

As we scale, we’re looking for a passionate, visionary Head of Sales to lead and drive Beam’s revenue growth, build strategic relationships, and help shape the future of our sales strategy. This is a unique opportunity to join a mission-driven, fast-growing startup with the chance to make a direct impact on the world by:

  • Leading Sales Strategy and Execution

  • Working closely with the CEO & CTO (Founders) and the Head of Client Strategy to align on business priorities and go-to-market strategies. Serve as a key ambassador for Beam to external stakeholders, representing the brand and its values at industry events, conferences, and in partnership meetings.

  • Building, mentoring, and managing a high-performing Senior AE team. Developing sales talent to hit both short-term and long-term revenue goals.

  • Identifying, negotiating, and securing high-value brand partnerships that amplify Beam’s impact. Collaborating with client strategy and partnerships teams to develop tailored partnership proposals that resonate with target brands and corporate partners.

  • Leading efforts to explore and validate new markets and verticals for growth, leveraging data and insights to guide expansion strategies.

ABOUT YOU

This is a leadership role for someone who is deeply passionate about social impact and wants to drive Beam’s growth while making a real difference in the world. You thrive in dynamic, fast-paced environments and have a proven track record of building and scaling sales teams at high-growth startups.

We’re looking for:

  • 8+ years in sales, with at least 2-3 years managing and scaling a sales team in a high-growth startup environment (bonus points for experience in e-commerce, SaaS, or social impact sectors).

  • A strong history of exceeding sales targets, driving growth, and building long-lasting, mutually beneficial partnerships.

  • You can see the big picture, strategically plan for growth, and pivot as needed based on market trends and data insights.

  • Ability to clearly articulate the vision of Beam and inspire both internal and external stakeholders. You are a natural storyteller, skilled in pitching complex ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences.

  • Highly analytical, using data and metrics to shape decisions and strategies.

  • A Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or a related field (or relevant equivalent experience).

BENEFITS & PERKS

In addition to cash compensation, stock, healthcare, and remote work, Beam will also offer the following perks, as further set forth in the applicable policies:

  • Unlimited PTO: All Beam team members are entitled to unlimited paid time off, with a requirement to take a minimum of two weeks per year.

  • Health and wellness: Your choice of Medical, Dental, and Vision Aetna plans, including some that are fully covered plus a $100 monthly wellness stipend to be used at your discretion (e.g., gym memberships, yoga, meditation apps, etc.)

  • Parental leave: All parents are entitled to paid leave per Beam’s parental leave policy. Upon your start date, this includes twelve weeks of fully paid leave after six months of full-time employment at Beam.

  • Professional development enrichment: $750 / year in professional development stipend for conferences, books, course enrollment, and more

  • Regular team events and volunteering, including virtual options

  • Regular on-sites: Travel and hotel covered for on-sites 1-2x per year for the entire Beam team to come together for team-building in NYC

  • Referral bonus: $1,000 referral bonuses for every new member of the growing Beam team that you send our way

  • Remote first with optional NYC HQ: This role may be conducted fully remotely, with the option to work from our gorgeous New York City HQ with sunlight, plants, drinks, snacks, and energy

REPORTING

You will report to Beam’s CEO.

COMPENSATION

Your total compensation consists of four parts: base salary, performance based bonus at on-target earnings, partial 401k match, and stock options.

Total cash compensation for this role is $380,000 - $400,000 OTE per year.

Beam is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

We are a remote-friendly company that is able to hire in all 50 states and D.C and Canada. We can’t sponsor working visas, so all applicants will need to have work authorization in the US or Canada.

jobs.title: Manager, Billing & Collections
jobs.descriptionHtml:
ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES

Beam is on a mission to shift $10B from brands to high-impact nonprofits by creating what loyalty would look like if it were designed for today’s customers.

This is a unique opportunity to have a massive individual impact: our products have rapidly scaled to millions of users, driving tremendous resources to nonprofits and inspiring more people to start making a bigger impact every day.

As with any fast-growing, early-stage team, responsibilities are likely to evolve. The Manager of Billing and Finance can expect to work closely with 3-4 other members of Beam’s growing team to:

  • Oversee the full billing cycle, including accurate and timely invoicing across SaaS and usage-based pricing models

  • Review, adjust, and reconcile invoices to ensure accuracy and alignment with client agreements

  • Manage accounts receivable by proactively monitoring outstanding balances and following up with clients to secure timely payments

  • Serve as the primary point of contact for billing inquiries, resolving discrepancies and ensuring a positive client experience

  • Partner with Finance, Sales, and Client Strategy teams to streamline processes, improve reporting accuracy, and support revenue operations

ABOUT YOU

This is a client-facing role for someone who thrives at the intersection of billing, operations, and customer engagement. The ideal candidate is analytical, detail-oriented, persistent, and energized by solving complex problems in a fast-moving environment. They are just as comfortable working through spreadsheets and SQL queries as they are professionally following up with clients on overdue invoices.

We're looking for:

  • 4–7 years of experience in billing, finance operations, or revenue operations (preferably in a SaaS or usage-based pricing environment)

  • Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple accounts, deadlines, and priorities simultaneously

  • Comfort navigating financial tools and systems (nice-to-haves: Salesforce, Stripe, SQL, Google Sheets, Jira)

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a professional but persistent approach to client interactions

  • A process-driven mindset with the ability to identify inefficiencies and suggest improvements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, or equivalent experience

BENEFITS & PERKS

In addition to cash compensation, stock, healthcare, and remote work, Beam will also offer the following perks, as further set forth in the applicable policies:

  • Unlimited PTO: All Beam team members are entitled to unlimited paid time off, with a requirement to take a minimum of two weeks per year.

  • Health and wellness: Your choice of Medical, Dental, and Vision Aetna plans, including some that are fully covered plus a $100 monthly wellness stipend to be used at your discretion (e.g., gym memberships, yoga, meditation apps, etc.)

  • Parental leave: All parents are entitled to paid leave per Beam’s parental leave policy. Upon your start date, this includes twelve weeks of fully paid leave after six months of full-time employment at Beam.

  • Professional development enrichment: $750 / year in professional development stipend for conferences, books, course enrollment, and more

  • Regular team events and volunteering, including virtual options

  • Regular on-sites: Travel and hotel covered for on-sites 1-2x per year for the entire Beam team to come together for team-building in NYC

  • Referral bonus: $1,000 referral bonuses for every new member of the growing Beam team that you send our way

  • Remote first with optional NYC HQ: This role may be conducted fully remotely, with the option to work from our gorgeous New York City HQ with sunlight, plants, drinks, snacks, and energy

REPORTING

You will report to Beam's Chief of Staff.

COMPENSATION

Your total compensation consists of four parts: base salary, performance based bonus at on-target earnings, partial 401k match, and stock options.

Total cash compensation for this role is $100,000-$130,000 per year.

Beam is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

We are a remote-friendly company that is able to hire in all 50 states and D.C and Canada. We can’t sponsor working visas, so all applicants will need to have work authorization in the US or Canada.
